newsitem.title: GERMANY: German BHW is good speculative bet - research group.
newsitem.headline: German BHW is good speculative bet - research group.

text.p: Soon-to-be-floated German savings, finance and insurance group BHW Holdings AG may be a good speculative bet but is less attractive in the long-term, German analysis firm Independent Research said on Friday.

Shares in BHW, which is planning a flotation on April 28 with volume of around one billion marks, are on offer via a bookbuilding process at between 22-28 marks each. Final pricing is due April 26 and allocation details come the day after.
Independent Research said that such a price level could offer investors the chance for a quick profit but said long-term investors should be more cautious.

It said a price set at the upper end of the bookbuilding range would put BHW on a price-earnings ratio of over 23 on current year estimated earnings, compared to a range of between 18-19 in the rest of the bank sector.
It advised investors to start taking profit on the stock once it rose above 30 marks. Dresdner Bank, joint lead manager of the issue, is confident the offer will be some two times oversubscribed.
BHW specialises in private lending for real estate projects.
